name: response-ratelimiting
hubDesc: Rate-Limiting based on a custom response header value
description:
This plugin allows you to limit the number of requests a developer can make based on a custom response header returned by the upstream service. You can arbitrary set as many rate-limiting objects (or quotas) as you want and instruct Kong to increase or decrease them by any number of units. Each custom rate-limiting object can limit the inbound requests per seconds, minutes, hours, days, months or years.

If the underlying Service/Route (or deprecated API entity) has no authentication layer, the Client IP address will be used, otherwise the Consumer will be used if an authentication plugin has been configured.

fields.name: limits
fields.help: This is a list of custom objects that you can set, with arbitrary names set in the {limit_name} placeholder, like config.limits.sms.minute=20 if your object is called “SMS”.

fields.name: header_name
fields.help: The name of the response header used to increment the counters.

fields.name: block_on_first_violation
fields.help: A boolean value that determines if the requests should be blocked as soon as one limit is being exceeded. This will block requests that are supposed to consume other limits too.

fields.name: limit_by
fields.help: The entity that will be used when aggregating the limits: consumer, credential, ip. If the consumer or the credential cannot be determined, the system will always fallback to ip.

fields.name: policy
fields.help: The rate-limiting policies to use for retrieving and incrementing the limits. Available values are local (counters will be stored locally in-memory on the node), cluster (counters are stored in the datastore and shared across the nodes) and redis (counters are stored on a Redis server and will be shared across the nodes).

fields.name: fault_tolerant
fields.help: A boolean value that determines if the requests should be proxied even if Kong has troubles connecting a third-party datastore. If true requests will be proxied anyways effectively disabling the rate-limiting function until the datastore is working again. If false then the clients will see 500 errors.

fields.name: redis_host
fields.help: When using the redis policy, this property specifies the address to the Redis server.

fields.name: redis_port
fields.help: When using the redis policy, this property specifies the port of the Redis server.

fields.name: redis_password
fields.help: When using the redis policy, this property specifies the password to connect to the Redis server.

fields.name: redis_timeout
fields.help: When using the redis policy, this property specifies the timeout in milliseconds of any command submitted to the Redis server.

fields.name: redis_database
fields.help: When using the redis policy, this property specifies Redis database to use.
